    • Constructor Detail

      • SwitchBox

        public SwitchBox()
        Constructor initialize the serial connection. This constructor initialized the serial connection without any information of a preferred ComPort.

      • SwitchBox

        public SwitchBox(java.lang.String preferCom)
        Constructor initialize the serial connection. This constructor initialized the serial connection with a preferred ComPort. So the program first test the preferred ComPort.
        Parameters:
        preferCom - = for example "COM1"

    • Method Detail

      • getComPort

        public java.lang.String getComPort()
        Current connected ComPort Return the connected ComPort. The ComPort can be saved in the configuration of the external program for a faster connection in the next class initialization.
        Returns:
        for example COM1

      • init

        public boolean init(java.lang.String preferCom)
        Initialize the Serial Connection Initialize the Serial Connection by testing all available port and searching the port with the right answer. He starts with the preferred Port if it is available.
        Returns:
        true is online

        false is offline

      • serialAvailable

        public boolean serialAvailable()
        Testing the existence of an open serial port.
        Returns:
        true is online

        false is offline

      • getStatus

        public com.switching.Status getStatus()
        Status call Read the status of the switch box.
        Returns:
        all values are UNKNOWN if there is no serial contact.

      • activateUsb

        public boolean activateUsb(java.lang.Integer number)
        Activate USB Port Activate the USB Port with the defined number.
        Parameters:
        number - Number of the USB Port (1-4)
        Returns:
        true = activated

        false = not activated, there can be problems with the serial connection or a arduino problem

      • deactivateUsb

        public boolean deactivateUsb()
        Deactivate USB Ports.
        Returns:
        true = activated

        false = not activated, there can be problems with the serial connection or a arduino problem

      • setAutoPowerOnState

        public boolean setAutoPowerOnState(boolean state)
        Set the auto power on state. If the auto power on state is active, the arduino starts the power after booting.
        Parameters:
        state - true = activate

        false = deactivate

        Returns:
        true = state set was ok

        false = state set error, no connection or wrong answer

      • powerOn

        public boolean powerOn()
        Start power.
        Returns:
        true = state set was ok

        false = state set error, no connection or wrong answer

      • powerOff

        public boolean powerOff()
        Stop power.
        Returns:
        true = state set was ok

        false = state set error, no connection or wrong answer

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Close the serial connection.
